abstract: Prepares a reusable cell for reuse by the table view’s delegate.
overview:
## Discussion

If a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell] object has a reuse identifier, the table view invokes this method just before returning the object from the `UITableView` method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/dequeueReusableCell(withIdentifier:)]. To avoid potential performance issues, you should only reset attributes of the cell that are not related to content, for example, alpha, editing, and selection state. The table view’s delegate in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)] should *always* reset all content when reusing a cell.

The table view doesn’t call this method if the cell object doesn’t have an associated reuse identifier, or if you use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/reconfigureRows(at:)] to update the contents of an existing cell.

If you override this method, you must be sure to invoke the superclass implementation.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/prepareForReuse()
crawled: 2025-12-03T18:28:47Z

# prepareForReuse()

**Instance Method**

Prepares a reusable cell for reuse by the table view’s delegate.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func prepareForReuse()
```

## Discussion

If a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell] object has a reuse identifier, the table view invokes this method just before returning the object from the `UITableView` method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/dequeueReusableCell(withIdentifier:)]. To avoid potential performance issues, you should only reset attributes of the cell that are not related to content, for example, alpha, editing, and selection state. The table view’s delegate in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)] should *always* reset all content when reusing a cell.

The table view doesn’t call this method if the cell object doesn’t have an associated reuse identifier, or if you use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/reconfigureRows(at:)] to update the contents of an existing cell.

If you override this method, you must be sure to invoke the superclass implementation.

## Reusing cells

- **reuseIdentifier**: A string for identifying a reusable cell.

items.description: A string for identifying a reusable cell.
